body_html: If you use set -e, I'd put it near the end after the configuration but before the bazel commands, or put it in the bazel_clean_and_fetch() function and unset it when it exits that function. Otherwise stuff like default_python_bin_path=$(which python) will fail the script if there is no python on the path.
body_text: If you use set -e, I'd put it near the end after the configuration but before the bazel commands, or put it in the bazel_clean_and_fetch() function and unset it when it exits that function. Otherwise stuff like default_python_bin_path=$(which python) will fail the script if there is no python on the path.
body: If you use `set -e`, I'd put it near the end after the configuration but before the bazel commands, or put it in the `bazel_clean_and_fetch()` function and unset it when it exits that function. Otherwise stuff like `default_python_bin_path=$(which python)` will fail the script if there is no python on the path.
